1.brief: Moab, an incestuous son of Lot; also his territory and descendants
properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
near, with or among; often in general, to
Nebo, the name of a Babylonian deity, also of a mountain in Moab, and of a place in Palestine

properly, to be burly, i.e. (figuratively) powerful (passively, impregnable); by implication, to ravage

to be ashamed, confused or disappointed; also (as failing) to dry up (as water) or wither (as herbage)
defence, high fort (tower), refuge, Misgab, a place in Moab
properly, to prostrate; hence, to break down, either (literally) by violence, or (figuratively) by confusion and fear

2.brief: a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
Moab, an incestuous son of Lot; also his territory and descendants
Cheshbon, a place East of the Jordan

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
to be dumb; by implication, to be astonished, to stop; also to perish
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement

great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent

to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
little; (in number) few; (in age) young, (in value) ignoble

an elevation, i.e. (concretely) acclivity or platform; abstractly (the relation or state) a rise or (figuratively) priority

a weeping; by analogy, a dripping

to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a juniper (from its nudity of situation)
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)

properly, heed; by implication, purpose (sake or account); used adverbially to indicate the reason or cause
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure

thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

a head person (of any rank or class)
